column1: Thanks to @RepBenMcAdams for serving Utah’s CD4. And congratulations to @BurgessOwens — I’m looking forward to working with you in Congress. https://t.co/F4LDhPWJC4

I’m so grateful to live in a country a state & a district where we have a deep reverance for our Veterans. I’d like to express to you my commitment to always appreciate & thank those who have worn the uniform for us for our freedom & our safety. Thank you & happy Veterans Day! https://t.co/rZo5kTu9lm

I’m very pleased to have the confirmation from voters that we are on the right track. Thank you for your support and for placing your trust in me. I am honored to be able to continue representing you in Congress. https://t.co/QdKup7nx55
Thank you for your continued support! https://t.co/sqYrbXx9xn

I'm looking forward to the next two years and combatting COVID-19 is my top priority. Mission No. 1 right now is helping individuals and particularly small businesses navigate this. https://t.co/4nLD3ocwtF

Thank you for your continued support! It is one of the greatest honors of my life to represent you in Congress. I’m very pleased to have the confirmation from voters that we are on the right track. Thank you Utah 3rd Congressional District! https://t.co/XihlPVEYVP

Today is the day! Ballots can be returned at any of the secured drop boxes located throughout your county until 8:00 PM on Election Day. Ballot pick-up locations are available and will be open from 7:00 AM to 8:00 PM. Visit https://t.co/UIhRsCVPO8 to find a location near you. https://t.co/1zOeWH0yTs

The deadline to postmark your ballot is TODAY November 2. Return your voted ballot today through the postal service or through a dropbox near you. Dropbox locations in-person ballot pick-up locations who/what is on the ballot etc. can all be found at https://t.co/UIhRsCVPO8. https://t.co/L0xkEDtif7

If you choose to return your ballot at a post office the deadline to postmark your ballot is November 2nd.   If you lose or spoil your ballot please call your county elections office or go to any in-person ballot pickup location during Early Voting or on Election Day.

Just a reminder to return your ballot to a secured drop box located throughout your county. Dropbox locations in-person ballot pick-up locations early voting who/what is on the ballot etc. can all be found at https://t.co/UIhRsCVPO8. https://t.co/WHCCBYDtHh

Do you have your campaign socks yet?! Contribute $20.20 + $7.00 for shipping & we'll send you a pair. 😎 You can claim your socks at https://t.co/Amm0X9zudN. They’re limited edition so order before they’re gone!  When you get your socks post a pic with the hashtag #CurtisSocks https://t.co/EvJVxQzIp3

New yard signs are in! Putting up a sign is an easy & effective way to show your support. If you would like to request a yard sign please contact Adrielle at info@johncurtis.org. Signs are first-come first-served and are going fast. If you'd like one please let us know today! https://t.co/xBNCtLWZGm

Real life vs. Twitter! 😂 Here's a look behind the scenes of my office while I was recording my speech for PBS Utah. You'd never know my office was in boxes and that I was sporting shorts and socks.  ICYMI - you can watch the full video here: https://t.co/WyhsqTiyyG https://t.co/OJhf8xpiPe

If you missed Utah's 3rd Congressional District debate you can watch it here. I appreciated the opportunity to participate. Thanks to the @UtahDebateCom for hosting this event. https://t.co/5mkYNwrkme https://t.co/n1fbpiq9We

The 3rd Congressional District Debate is tonight at 6:00 PM! The event will be available to watch on local TV stations stream online and listen to on local radio stations. Be sure to tune in tonight!  https://t.co/hwT383M128 https://t.co/ntex5PKhL9

Check your mailbox this week! 📬 Ballots have been mailed out to all registered voters. If you do not receive a ballot by October 16 please contact Utah County Elections office at 801-851-8128.  Make sure that your voting info is up-to-date or register at https://t.co/4m58qgZm0h https://t.co/SW2ZdieQUb

I had an amazing weekend walking precincts & talking with voters in North Carolina’s Moore County with my good friend @RichHudson. He’s a great Member of Congress & has earned the support of his constituents. I’m looking forward to serving with him again. Good luck #TeamHudson! https://t.co/A6O9A6bOp0

Deer Creek Reservoir is vital to Utah’s economy both for water supply and for recreation. We urge the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency to issue a WIFIA loan for the Deer Creek Raw Water Intake Project. https://t.co/ejWmwqeo9f

With unemployment levels at a record high our goal should be to deliver targeted aid to those who desperately need it most. Local economies across the country are working tirelessly to reopen in the safest way possible to help get Americans back to work - let's help them do so.
On Friday I introduced the Returning Inappropriate Cash Handouts (RICH) Act to bar anyone with an income of $1 million or more this year from receiving unemployment payments. https://t.co/O2DwHqCaAr

America’s top-level athletes should be able to focus on the sport they love & not worry about being taken advantage of by bad actors. As co-chair of Olympic Caucus I'm proud to introduce the bipartisan Empowering Olympic Paralympic & Amateur Athletes Act. https://t.co/xZEazh8YIU

I have introduced new legislation to help America's small businesses keep their doors open. Learn more about how the bipartisan Paycheck Protection Program Small Business Enhancement Act will provide more resources for our hard-working small businesses: https://t.co/N8rIo78XQ0
A second PPP loan could be make-or-break for these mostly family-owned establishments and fighting to keep their doors open is a cause that I am unquestioningly willing to support. (3/4)

Like Southeastern Utah – from tour companies that organize trips to Utah’s natural treasures to bussing companies that transport adventurous travelers from across the globe through our famed national parks. (2/4)
Despite receiving a Paycheck Protection Program loan countless Utah small businesses remain shuttered and need more resources. This is especially the case in many of our tourism communities. (1/4)

Additionally as the Republican sponsor of the SOAR Act I'm happy to see this bill moving & with such broad & bipartisan support for recreation. The SOAR Act will streamline recreation permitting & make our public lands more accessible to all Americans. https://t.co/NAR36vKzHa

When these fires grow our firefighters need to have every tool available to protect life and property. My AIR Safety Act will take a closer look at drone incursions and ways that we can remove interfering drones and deter incursions in the first place. https://t.co/VigY80lA7n
Two of my bipartisan bills were included in a Natural Resources unanimous consent package: the AIR Safety Act and the SOAR Act. https://t.co/qeny8XUqi4

I'm a proud cosponsor of the Expanding Child Care Access Grants Act which provides grants for employers to establish child care options for their employees. This bill provides a way for Utahns to have access to child care w/ a fraction of the price tag. https://t.co/qdFOdAjhk5

Access to child care is a key factor to getting Utahns back to work but simply throwing billions of dollars at the industry & tacking on more regulations will not fix the problem. Congress should reduce barriers to affordable child care while being responsible w/ taxpayer money.

Salt Lake and Utah Counties are in need of more widely accessible opportunities to hike bike and get outdoors. This legislation will do this in a responsible manner and help pave the way for all Utahns to enjoy this world-class trail. https://t.co/JZjruWmfvK

By working w/ a broad range of stakeholders this legislation will allow regulatory flexibility without hamstringing the technological pioneers who are developing smart technologies while ensuring consumers are aware of the capabilities of items they are putting in their homes. https://t.co/b47ET4slJF
My new bipartisan bill balances protecting American consumers while continuing to foster innovation. https://t.co/xfssUZU9JF

The people of Hong Kong have demonstrated a desire to fight for the freedom-based American values we hold dear. The Hong Kong Safe Harbor Act will empower Hong Kongers to continue their fight for freedom while letting them know the U.S. has their back. https://t.co/nJyFB3zAV4

As Lt. Governor @SpencerJCox guided our state through the most prosperous decade in our history. Over the past few months he has helped lead our State through one of the most challenging periods we’ve ever faced. https://t.co/rlt5Gmr0eF

I’ve worked w/ @SpencerJCox during my time as Provo Mayor & now as a member of the US House of Representatives. He's a proven leader & consistent conservative. He has a strong track record of standing up for Utah values: strong families limited government & economic opportunity. https://t.co/3H5DrY9Mod

We are eternally grateful to all our heroes in the armed forces who fight to defend our freedom. On this day of reverence we honor and remember all the serviceman and women who have fought and sacrificed for our country throughout our nation's history. #MemorialDay #🇺🇸 https://t.co/dw8uAoDW6A

As we continue to fight the COVID-19 pandemic our local communities that rely on strong tourism and seasonal business will be among the most economically vulnerable. It is crucial that we take all the necessary steps to protect them. https://t.co/JBtBK0SYSG

I'm honored to be selected by Leader McCarthy to join the newly-formed China Task Force. My time in the region has given me a unique understanding of the history culture and language which I will use as the China Task Force tackles these issues head-on. https://t.co/4W7hq3J69K

This also gives thousands of Utahns who filed unemployment over the past month the ability to obtain health care in the event of contracting COVID-19 while also allowing our front line workers to purchase affordable health care in the event of contracting the virus on the job.

This legislation would especially be a game-changer for Utah’s small business community by ensuring our hard-working business owners their workforce and their families have access to affordable health coverage. https://t.co/FO8cTiXR2m

As a former small business owner I have a soft spot for these courageous entrepreneurs making constant sacrifices to grow our economy. They need more help and now. I’m grateful to vote to replenish the Paycheck Protection Program. https://t.co/jmRL5K9KSF

Thank you delegates! I’ve enjoyed meeting with you virtually answering your questions and earning your vote. I have been working hard to get things done for Utah and I will continue to fight for our constituents. Thank you for your continued support. https://t.co/P0xWCEcSZu
Happy 🌎 Day! From one of my favorite places on Earth. ♥️ https://t.co/0eiMuLnEZc

I introduced the bipartisan Wildfire & Community Health Response Act to ensure our wildland firefighters are healthy & ready to respond to the upcoming fire season take steps to minimize wildfire risk for the coming months & be safe through the pandemic. https://t.co/HEwi2OWdDV

I led a letter to the Department of the Interior Secretary David Bernhardt asking that he temporarily suspend defer or reduce royalty rates to help essential industries survive the economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. Read full letter: https://t.co/CKBvCfeDcn

The CARES Act is the largest economic disaster recovery package in our nation’s history. It’s a hefty price tag that must be paid but I challenged my colleagues to join me in dealing with the consequences of spending money we don’t have. https://t.co/Q3hTcdDa1q

It would sanction foreign officials who conceal info about public health relating to a pandemic particularly #COVID-19 and incentivizes foreign leaders to be proactive with their decisions preventing the spread of a virus that could endanger American lives.
My new bill the Li Wenliang Public Health Accountability Act named after the heroic Chinese whistleblower enables the United States to set a global standard of transparency. https://t.co/d1SQKHTtcz

Happy #InternationalWomensDay! To celebrate the leadership that women bring to the world I invite you to call a woman running for public office in your area. Ask her your meaningful questions and give her a chance to tell you why she’s the best candidate in the race. https://t.co/AER7hB7PGx

I’m proud to see unanimous passage of my bill the TAIPEI Act which strengthens Taiwan’s position in the world by promoting free trade negotiations supporting Taiwan’s participation in international organizations & protecting its relations w/ its allies. https://t.co/25gCzbOvba

I was glad for the chance to advocate for bipartisan efforts to spur innovation export US clean energy technology and combat foreign rising emissions during the Natural Resources hearing. Read my full remarks here: https://t.co/5cMiziwMGn
🚨WATCH MY NEW 📺: Gets Things Done for Utah. 🚨 (It was as much fun to make as it looks). #CurtisForCongress https://t.co/XBG3k7HwZV https://t.co/6WUfNlk1sD
👀 https://t.co/w9RXdELhhm

And it will allow visa holders flexibility to move throughout the state as employment opportunities and demands shift. There’s no quick fix to our immigration system but I am excited to be proposing real common-sense solutions to address the problem. More:https://t.co/euyHj1jxIv

I joined Gov Herbert @CatoInstitute  for a discussion about state-based visas. My State Sponsored Visa Pilot Program Act grants states the flexibility to tailor a visa program based on their needs. It will create a tool to connect workers with industries that are most in need. https://t.co/RURPEamVl3

In Utah we take the responsibility to provide for ourselves and for our families seriously. We also understand the importance of showing compassion and giving back to those in need. I am happy to see the agency truly putting energy into delivering high-quality care.

I sent a letter of support to the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services about their new proposal which gives states the ability to customize their Medicaid programs based on the needs of their citizens. https://t.co/0DpfiMbw3N

The Recreational Trails Program has created countless opportunities for motorized recreation & human-powered experiences. This bill will ensure that future generations get to visit the great outdoors while supporting local economies especially rural areas https://t.co/kTn9NBPOtB

I'm proud to introduce the bipartisan "Making Access To Cleanup Happen (MATCH) Act" to expedite wildfire disaster cleanup save taxpayers money and prevent further disasters. Read more here: https://t.co/Davj9js7zK

After a wildfire disaster the land is left at its most vulnerable. Rehabilitation and protection efforts must be quickly implemented to guard against further damage and in most cases the workload continues to increase as a project waits for the federal government’s approval. https://t.co/wpZMMin6JD
